english: swallow (bird); swallow (to swall; joyful; to sing)

etymology.description: Depicts a swallow, a type of bird known for its graceful flight.
etymology.interpretation: The character visually represents the bird itself, which is often associated with joy and charm.

examples.chinese: 燕子飞得很快(燕子飛得很快)，真美丽(真美麗)！
examples.pinyin: Yànzi fēi dé hěn kuài, zhēn měilì!
examples.english: The swallow flies very fast, truly beautiful!

examples.chinese: 春天来了，燕子筑巢(春天來了，燕子築巢)。
examples.english: Spring has come, the swallows are building nests.

examples.chinese: 我听见燕儿的歌声(我聽見燕兒的歌聲)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ tīngjiàn yàn er de gēshēng.
examples.english: I hear the song of the swallows.
